newsitem.title: USA: Goodyear to buy stakes in Slovenian tire group.
newsitem.headline: Goodyear to buy stakes in Slovenian tire group.

text.p: Goodyear Tire & Rubber Co. said on Monday it agreed to buy controlling stakes in two units of Sava Group in the Republic of Slovenia.
The company said it was acquiring a 60 percent interest in Sava's tire business and a 75 percent stake in its engineered products business.
Goodyear did not disclose the value of the deals, but said the purchase prices would be announced in mid-summer when they are expected to be completed.
It was Goodyear's second major acquisition in Eastern Europe. Last year the company acquired a majority stake in the operations of a Polish tire company, TC Debica.

"The joint venture involving Sava's engineered products business is strategic to Goodyear's growth by providing a European manufacturing based operation," it said. Currently, the company's customers are supplied with products from other regions.
Sava Group reported total sales of $245 million in 1996, of which $177 million was for car and commercial truck tires.
